description: Detailed mysqld-exporter metrics for single instance deep-dive analysis

options.content: üè†
${instance}

panels.description:
List of all exporters available for instance **${instance}**

Click on exporter name to view detailed dashboard.

**Status**: 1 = UP, 0 = DOWN
panels.title: Exporters for ${instance}

options.content: ${exporter}
üîç

panels.description: MySQL server uptime in days. If this value is low, the server recently restarted.
panels.title: MySQL Uptime

panels.description:
Current number of active connections vs maximum allowed.

**Thresholds**: 
- Current > 80% of max = critical, review connection pooling
- Current > 60% of max = warning, monitor closely
- Current < 40% of max = normal
panels.title: Active Connections

panels.description:
Total queries per second (QPS) executed by MySQL server.

**Thresholds**: 
- QPS spikes > 200% of baseline = investigate query causing spike
- Sustained high QPS > 10000 = consider scaling
- Sudden drop to 0 = connection issue or server problem
panels.title: Query Rate (QPS)

panels.description:
Slow queries per second. Slow queries indicate inefficient SQL or missing indexes.

**Thresholds**: 
- Slow queries > 10/sec = review slow query log, optimize queries
- Slow queries > 1/sec = monitor and plan optimization
- Slow queries ~ 0 = normal, good performance
panels.title: Slow Queries Rate

panels.description:
InnoDB read and write operations per second. Positive values = reads, negative values = writes.

**Thresholds**: 
- Read/Write ratio >> 10:1 = read-heavy workload (consider read replicas)
- Write spikes > 1000/sec = check for batch operations
- Sustained high I/O = consider storage upgrade
panels.title: InnoDB Read/Write Operations

panels.description:
Percentage of InnoDB buffer pool pages currently in use (non-free pages)

< 70% ‚Äî Good
Plenty of free buffer pool memory available.

70‚Äì90% ‚Äî Normal
Expected under steady workload. Monitor together with hit ratio.

> 90% ‚Äî Critical
Buffer pool is nearly full. Risk of increased disk I/O and performance degradation.
Investigate queries, memory sizing, and buffer pool configuration.
panels.title: InnoDB Buffer Pool

panels.description:
Network traffic in bytes per second. Positive values = sent (outbound), negative values = received (inbound).

**Thresholds**: 
- Network spikes = large query results or data export
- Sustained high outbound = many large SELECTs
- Sustained high inbound = many INSERTs/UPDATEs
panels.title: Network Traffic (Bytes Sent/Received)

panels.description:
Table locks waiting indicates queries blocked waiting for table locks.

**Thresholds**: 
- Locks waiting > 10 = table lock contention, consider InnoDB instead of MyISAM
- Locks waiting > 5 = monitor for blocking queries
- Locks waiting = 0 = normal, no contention
panels.title: Table Locks
